Posted By: MasterOfBearLore (10/12/2011 12:38:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
For those who were hoping for a [Firebolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firebolt) reprint, there's your 5 flashback for 2 damage at sorcery speed.  
  
The variable cost is probably not enough to make up for the consistency of being able to deal 2 for {R} turn 1, but it may be strong enough to see some play.  
  
As an aside, this is making me a little nostalgic for [Hammer of Bogardan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hammer of Bogardan). And we all know if it's ever going to see a Standard reprint, it's going to be under Garfield. Come on man, I'm counting on you to make spells great again! ;)
posts.html:
For those who were hoping for a Firebolt reprint, there's your 5 flashback for 2 damage at sorcery speed.

The variable cost is probably not enough to make up for the consistency of being able to deal 2 for {R} turn 1, but it may be strong enough to see some play.

As an aside, this is making me a little nostalgic for Hammer of Bogardan. And we all know if it's ever going to see a Standard reprint, it's going to be under Garfield. Come on man, I'm counting on you to make spells great again! ;)

posts.post_content:
One more card for my [Fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireball) collection. Flashback makes it more versatile than its siblings, because it can be played from the graveyard.
  
I like it they print one new reflavored and mechanically different [Fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireball) every block:
  
   
   
Ravnica: [Demonfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonfire), which has the Rakdos guild's "Hellbent" mechanic.
  
Time Spiral: [Disintegrate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disintegrate), which was originally printed in Alpha. Fits Time Spiral's "reliving the past" theme very well.
  
Lorwyn: [Titan's Revenge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Titan's Revenge), which has the "clash" mechanic and is tailored to fit Lorwyn's Giant tribe.
  
Alara: [Banefire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Banefire), which features [Sarkhan Vol](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan Vol), a planeswalker introduced in that set. My favourite one.
  
Zendikar: [Comet Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Comet Storm): has the "kicker" mechanic.
  
Scars of Mirrodin: [Red Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Red Sun's Zenith), which is part of the "Zenith" cycle.
  
Innistrad: This, which has the "Flashback" mechan... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Eternal_Blue (9/27/2011 12:22:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
That’s super solid, super hot. You get the essence of fireball, and you get a very reasonable flashback cost. There really is no loss or much drawback for slotting a set of these in your red/burn decks, especially because you’re getting at least double the spell opportunity. Once again, very respectful flashback cost, and during the latter rounds the flashback cost leaves you with plenty of mana to pump it.  
How can this card be better? If it was an instant. Do I really expect it to be an instant? No. This card is pretty much exactly the way it should be; well done.  
Lots of fun in the artwork and sizzling flavour text. 4½ stars.
posts.html:
That’s super solid, super hot. You get the essence of fireball, and you get a very reasonable flashback cost. There really is no loss or much drawback for slotting a set of these in your red/burn decks, especially because you’re getting at least double the spell opportunity. Once again, very respectful flashback cost, and during the latter rounds the flashback cost leaves you with plenty of mana to pump it.
How can this card be better? If it was an instant. Do I really expect it to be an instant? No. This card is pretty much exactly the way it should be; well done.
Lots of fun in the artwork and sizzling flavour text. 4½ stars.

Posted By: willpell (1/28/2012 1:23:05 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
HuntingDrake;  
that's an apostrophe, not a comma; and it's supposed to sound satanic. You're talking about a spell that burns things, in a world based on gothic horror, in a game set in a fantasy setting where devils and demons aren't exactly taboo. "satan" really isn't a factor here, unless you're a soccer mom worried that cards will steal your child's immortal soul - but even taking that into account, I think if any sort of card should seem satanic, it'd be one like this.
posts.html:
HuntingDrake;
that's an apostrophe, not a comma; and it's supposed to sound satanic. You're talking about a spell that burns things, in a world based on gothic horror, in a game set in a fantasy setting where devils and demons aren't exactly taboo. Posted By: DarthParallax (11/1/2011 4:58:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Considering how many people considers playing Geistflame, this card truly shines as a hidden gem yet to be discovered in Standard. Okay, if this is used as a Geistflame, it costs one more and is a sorcery. However, this in most cases isn't going to be used as a Geistflame, save for the flashback. Turn 1 Illusion killer, turn 2 Gutshot, turn 3 Shock, turn 4 Incinerate, turn 5 and up: best spell to have in hand.
